meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being fit for a voyage at sea.
meanings.sent1: The seaworthinesses of the ship were evident as it sailed smoothly through the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Before setting sail, the captain always checks the seaworthinesses of the vessel to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The crew joked that the seaworthinesses of the old boat were so good, it could even outrun a dolphin!
meanings.sent4: Her confidence in the seaworthinesses of the yacht was like a shield against the stormy waves.
meanings.sent5: The seaworthinesses of the boat shone brightly like a guiding star in the vast sea.

meanings.definition: The ability of a vessel to withstand rough seas and adverse weather conditions.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the seaworthinesses of the ship kept it steady amidst the raging waves.
meanings.sent2: The seaworthinesses of the fishing boat allowed it to navigate through the turbulent waters effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The sailors were amazed by the seaworthinesses of the tiny raft in the midst of the storm.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, the seaworthinesses of the vessel proved its strength like a mighty fortress.
meanings.sent5: The seaworthinesses of the sailboat was a beacon of hope in the midst of the tempest.
